column1: fuller on the stumps, Tamim comes forward and drives it towards mid-on
glorious shot, driven through covers for four. Once again pitched up but plenty of room for Tamim to free arms who leans into the drive
beaten! Fuller around off and swinging away. Wasn't as full as previous ball but Tamim once again went for the drive, more like pushing with hands, the ball goes past the outside edge
length, much closer to the stumps, Tamim covers his off stumps and shoulders arms
length on the stumps, not much movement though. Defended from the back foot
length outside off, 130.4kph, moving away just a little bit off the seam, ignored
short of length outside off, 125.kph, a hint of movement back, left alone
length around off, this one shapes away from the batsman, Shadman was hoping around in the crease, defends from the back foot in the end
fuller on the pads, clips it towards square leg to get off the mark
fuller but way down the leg side, Tamim is not interested
length around off and angling across Tamim, who comes forward and leaves it alone
length ball on the pads, flicks it towards backward square leg, shouts of 'catch' as it was in the air for a while but away from any of the fielders
fuller on the stumps, Tamim comes forward and drives firmly, a diving stop by Wagner to his right at short midwicket
length outside off, Tamim goes back and looks to cut it hard, gets beaten as the ball moves away
struck on the pads but heading down. Length ball around off and middle, Tamim plants his front foot across and puts himself in a tangle as the ball keeps coming in to the batsman
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it to the left of mid-off for a single
short of length around off, some extra bounce this time, Shadman stays back and taps it towards cover-point. Not very convincing, I must say
length ball just outside off, Shadman is expecting it to move away and shoulders arms but the ball holds its line and just misses the off stump
fuller around off, 129kph, Tamim goes for the drive but misses as the ball moves away from him
length outside off, 128.7kph, stays in his crease this time, very watchful, and leaves it alone in the end
fuller on the stumps, comes forward to drive but the ball swings in and hits the inner half of the bat, dribbles towards mid-on
fuller but fifth stump line, Tamim comes forward before letting it go
length ball on the pads, stays back and dabs it towards square leg
length outside off, 128.9kph, angling across the left-hand batsman who is happy to leave it
beaten, 136.5kph. Shadman is stuck at the crease, hardly any footwork, Boult pitches it on a length around fourth stump and beats the outside edge
length, much wider this time and swinging away, left alone
fuller on the pads, clipped square off the wicket, Wagner from mid-on chases it
short of length outside off, 139.6kph, punched off the back foot towards extra cover
length around off, looks to drive on the up, away from the body and gets beaten as the ball swings away from him
slightly shorter this time, room outside off, slashes hard and gets it past point for four
length ball on the stumps, defended towards short mid-on from the back foot
length ball around leg stump, wobbles past the batsman, moving away to beat the back foot defence, Watling fumbles behind the stumps as it's still wobbling, Taylor at first slip tidies it up
pitched up on the stumps and Shadman drives it past mid-off for his first boundary
length around middle and off, comes forward and defends
length outside off, comes back in a little bit, left alone. Nice carry to the keeper
a thick outside edge goes between gully and backward point, fuller and wider outside off, Shadman pushes at it and gets a couple before Williamson from gully chases and throws it to the keeper
fuller outside off, Tamim comes forward and drives it through covers, right from the middle of the bat, holds the pose
another firm drive, this time back towards the bowler who makes a good stop in his followthrough, coming to the ball, it was fuller on the stumps
a bouncer this time, around off stump, Tamim ducks under comfortably
smashed! Another short one, this time at the batsman but Tamim was ready, pulls it towards midwicket for cracking boundary
length ball on the stumps, taps it behind square for a couple
fuller on the stumps, angling in towards the batsman who comes forward and drives it towards mid-on
fuller but down the leg side, Shadman was moving towards the off side, looks to get some bat on it, misses
length outside off, left alone, a bit of late inswing after it passes the batsman
fuller outside off, fifth stump line, comes forward and shoulders arms
length outside off, goes with the angle, left again
another glorious drive, this time from Shadman. Fuller outside off, the batsman comes forward and drives it past extra cover for four
short of length on the stumps, stays back and drops it at his feet
fuller on the stumps, drives firmly towards mid-on, Wagner makes the stop but gets hit on the finger. He's off the field for some treatment but luckily it's his non-bowling hand
short of length outside off, Tamim goes back and cuts it square off the wicket for four more
short again, goes back and crunches it behind point this time, four more
fuller around off, drives it towards mid-off this time
short of length on the stumps, stays back, rises on his toes and defends
pitched up on the stumps, goes for the drive but looks to hit too hard, mistimes it towards mid-on
short of length outside off, left alone by Shadman
length around off, comes forward and defends it right under his eyes
length outside off, angling in towards the batsman who leaves it alone
fuller outside off this time, looks to hit it down the ground, comes forward but mistimes it towards mid-off
fuller around off, drives it towards the right of mid-off, a tumbling partial stop by Grandhomme, Raval from extra cover tidies it up
length, just outside off, comes back in a little bit, left alone by the batsman
a loosener. Length ball on the pads, flicked square off the wicket for a single
length again, on middle and leg, defended on the leg side
fuller outside off, comes forward and drives it towards wide mid-off, Boult cuts it off
short of length outside off, rises on his toes and punches it towards in the direction of mid-off
length ball on middle and leg, comes forward and looks to defend, misses. A loud appeal for lbw but denied. Replays confirm there was a little inside edge
short of length outside off, punched towards covers
too full outside off, looks to drive but cannot connect
length outside off, angling across the batsman, almost squaring up the batsman to beat the bat
short of length on the pads, gets the batsman hopping, the ball goes over gully off the thigh pad
short of length outside off, some room as well, cuts it in front of square to bring up the fifty for Bangladesh
fuller on the stumps, driven but straight towards mid-on
short of length on middle and leg, extra bounce to hit the batsman on the thigh
length ball on middle and leg, comes forward and defends
skips down the ground to this length ball, and goes over the bowler's head. However, the timing is not great and in the end, the batsman scamper for two
short of length this time, pushes it towards mid-on from the back foot
length outside off, a bit loose from Tamim who looks to hit it through the off side, playing away from the body, gets an inside edge into the ground
short of length outside off, stays back and turns the face if the bat to guide it behind point
short of length at the batsman who jumps in his crease and dabs it down
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards extra cover, a tumbling stop there
a shout for lbw but pitching outside leg. Length ball and hits the batsman on the front pad, beating the bat but given not out
fuller around off, Tamim goes for the drive but mistimes it towards covers
short of length on the pads, tucked away towards square leg for a couple
short of length on the leg stump, beats the batsman and hits him on the body
fuller outside off, comes forward and drives it past cover, sweeper cuts it off
floated on the leg stump, comes forward and works it towards square leg
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards extra cover, but straight towards the fielder
length around off, goes for the cut but there is not enough room, gets an inside edge on to the back leg, lucky there
length around off, leaving the batsman, Tamim shoulders arms
length outside off, left alone once again
length around middle and leg, defended from the front foot
very full, slanting across to a fifth-stump line. Stabbed away into the point region
ooh, holds up on the pitch. Fullish, slanting away and inviting the cover drive. Tamim goes for it and inside-edges into his pad, pops into the square leg region
length ball close to off stump, pushed into the point region off the front foot
lovely line, slanting across the stumps and not too far away from off stump when Tami,m leaves it, trusting the angle even if the length was fairly full
shorter this time, easier leave for Tamim from a similar line
back of a length close to off stump, gets on his toes to punch gently into the point region
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to short midwicket

ooh, nice line and length, straightens into Tamim in the corridor. Tamim takes a big step across his stumps even before CdG delivers, and then presses forward to defend. Beats the inside edge narrowly
a touch straighter, tucked away off the hips through backward square leg
length ball straightening towards leg stump, worked away through square leg
stays back to a length ball slanting across to off stump, stays leg-side of the ball and waits on it before blocking into the point region
a touch overpitched outside off, drives with a flourish but can't beat short extra-cover

again the ball stops on the pitch a little. Fullish, angling across to pitch on off stump, fairly fulll. Doesn't get fully forward to drive and lets the hands take over. Ball rolls off the inside half of the bat into the midwicket region
ooh, leaves that on length. Pitches on about middle stump and straightens slightly. Left alone and it passes over the top of middle and off stumps
back of a length, a touch too straight, tucked away through backward square leg
length ball on middle and leg, gets on the front foot to clip to mid-on
fullish on leg stump, gets forward to clip it wide of mid-on
good leave. On the fuller side of a good length, pitching on or around off stump and continuing to angle away. Good stride forward and he watches it well before shouldering arms
back of a length, fairly wide of off, left alone
full on middle stump, doesn't really get a stride forward, lets it come on and defends under his eyes
ooh, swish and miss. Full again, wider this time and Shadman goes for the big, angled-bat drive. Fails to put bat on ball
exaggerated movement away from the left-handed, after pitching outside off and quite full. Left alone
full, angling into a fifth-stump line. Good stride forward for a slap to backward point
shot. Only slightly short, angling into off stump. Leans back, stays leg-side of the ball, and carves it away nicely to the right of backward point
half-volley just outside off stump. Can't beat extra-cover with this forcing drive
full on middle and off, driven to mid-off
full on middle and leg, driven crisply to mid-on
length ball pitching on middle and slanting away towards off. Not much of a stride forward, pushes at it with his hands and it rolls into the cover point region off the outside half of his bat
shortish on off stump, gets off his toes to ride the bounce and jab the ball down by his feet
ooh, in the blockhole, quick, on middle and off. Jams his bat down hurriedly to keep it out
back of a length outsiide off .Gets forward and dabs to the left of backward point
back of a length, sixth-stump line with a bit of extra bounce. Left alone
fuller length this time, wide outside off again, left alone

gone, de Grandhomme finally makes the breakthrough. Shadman's feet haven't moved all too enthusiastically today, and this ball tests his footwork alright. Angling into a fourth-stump line, pitching on a good length, straightening away. Presses half-forward to block and sends a thick edge into the lap of Ross Taylor falling to his right at first slip
length ball, fifth-stump line with a bit of extra bounce, left alone
a touch fuller, Mominul leaves it again
length ball on leg stump, clipped to the left of midwicket and they hurry through for one
shortish, gets up to ribcage height on around leg stump. Lets it come and tucks it past the right hand of the diving wicketkeeper
back of a length on middle and leg,tucked away into the squar3 leg region
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs with soft hands backward of point
back of a length on off stump, gets back and across to defend this
big appeal for lbw as Henry gets this one to nip away from a length and zip past the outside edge to hit the back leg. May have pitched just outside leg, though
length ball, sixth-stump line, left alone

length ball slanting in dramatically from wide of the crease, and he ends up playing around his front leg as he looks to work it leg side. Another big lbw appeal - this one may have been a little high
full outside off, left alone
back of a length, angling into off stump., Lets it come and pushes gently into the off side - short extra is a touch too deep and they sneak a quick single
full now, presses forward to block to mid-off
full, not quite close enough to off stump to make Mominul play
length ball slanting across, pitching on middle stump or thereabouts and leaving the left-hander slightly after pitching. Opens up as he defends this into the covers
nice length, gets some extra bounce and gets Watling to collect it at chest height after Tamim leaves. Straightened slightly as well, along a fifth-stump line
back of a length on leg stump, tucked watchfully to midwicket

back of a length, slants across to a fourth-stump line. Taps it on top of the bounce to pick up a single to the left of backward point, and brings up an excellent fifty, third time he's reached the half-century mark in as many innings in this series
shortish, slanting away from off stump, left alone
fuller now, pitches on off and continues to leave the left-hander. Mominul stays back and leaves again
ooh, sharp movement off the deck, pitching on a good length just outside off. Tamim pushes at the ball with hard hands and the ball beats his edge by a fair distance
fullish outside off, goes for the big drive, leaning back and ending up with bat over right shoulder, but can't beat mid-off
banged in short outside off, climbs up to over head height, sways away from the line
again some movement away after angling into off stump. Half-stride forward to defend, and the thick edge doesn't quite carry to second slip tumbling to his left
good leave. Again he gets the ball to nip away late after pitching on off stump. Tamim watches it well and leaves it alone
fullish, angling into off stump, nice stride forward to block to mid-on
back of a length on leg stump, worked away quietly through square leg
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, stays leg side of the ball and dabs into the point region
lovely delivery, angling into a fourth-stump line and nipping away off the seam to beat the outside edge as Mominul gets forward and across to defend
length ball angling into off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
length ball angling into middle stump, clipped into the backward square leg region

lovely delivery, cross-seam. Angling into a fifth-stump line, back of a length, and then nips away off the track. Stays leg-side of the ball to try and slap it through point, but he can't put bat to ball
length ball on off stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, gets nicely behind it to defend back to the bowler
full on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
length ball close to off stump, blocked back to the bowler
excellent leave. Judged the length perfectly there. Back of a length, angling into off stump and then nipping away with lots of extra bounce. Lifts his bat high over his head to ignore it
a little wider this time, left alone again
ooh, some movement back in from just outside off. Doesn't really get forward, pushes at the ball with his hands while trying to play into the covers. Thick inside edge into his thigh pad
put away. Fullish, drifts onto leg stump and Tamim clips it away to the right of the diving square leg fielder
length ball on off stump, presses forward to punch to short extra-cover
length ball angling into the pads, clipped to deep square leg
very full outside off. Has to go at it with an angled bat to try and drive it through point, and the inward angle beats his inside edge
full, close to off stump, shows the full face while playing a checked drive to mid-off
bouncer rising steeply over off stump. Tamim sways his upper body away from the line while dropping to his knees, and the airborne Watling can't quite reach the ball with his outstretched left glove
back of a length on off stump, punched into the cover point region
fullish, angling slightly down leg. Misses the flick and the ball clips the outside of his pad and forces the keeper to dive to his right to keep it from running away for leg-byes
banged in short, lots of width. Bounces too much for Mominul to connect with the slap over point
full, angling in and ending up close to off stump. Goes hard at the drive and the ball goes to midwicket off the inside half of his bat
fullish on middle stump, clipped away to the left of mid-on
back of a length, angling in from round the wicket into the fourth-stump channel. Left alone
banged in short and Tamim has to fetch this pull from about head height and outside off stump. Toe-ends it and juust gets it past mid-on diving to his right
length ball angling into middle stump, jabbed to short extra-cover. He's making a real effort to stay leg-side of the ball today
length ball wide of off stump. Not full enough to drive and the ball beats the edge as he throws an angled bat at it
short again on the fourth-stump channel. Gets off his feet to try and ride the bounce and ramp it over the slip cordon. Doesn't time his jump right and ends up bottom-edging into the ground instead
length ball close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs gently into the cover point region
length ball on the pads, tucks it away towards square leg for a single
short of length outside off, waits for it to come on to the bat, cuts it behind point for four
fuller outside off, comes forward and leaves it alone
short of length at the batsman, stays back and works it towards backward point
crunched! Fuller outside off, comes forward and drives it through covers for four, not for the first time this morning. What timing, what balance, making it look so easy
Wagner shortens his length this, time, around fifth stump, Tamim goes for the cut but gets beaten
length but way outside off, left alone

short of length, angling towards the batsman who gets an outside edge past gully, played with soft hands which meant it went towards the ground, Taylor puts in a slide at third man but cannot prevent the boundary as his foot was in touch with the skirting as he flicked the ball in
short of length angling in towards the batsman who sways away and drops his hands
another short one, this time more leg side-ish, Mominul moves inside the line
another bouncer but this one is further down the leg side, no problem in negotiating that
a touch fuller around off and middle, tucked away in front of square for an easy single
short of length around off, Mominul stays away from it, dropping the wrists as well

given caught behind but Mominul has reviewed straightaway. Was short of length outside off, Mominul pushes at it and gets beaten. There was definitely some noise but looks like it hit Mominul on the left bicep. Ruchira Palliyaguruge will have to change his decision

another appeal for caught-behind and given again. This time Mominul is walking back. Short of length near the rib cage, Mominul looks to get inside the line and leave it alone but it brushes the glove and Watling moves across to take it comfortably. Wagner gets his man eventually
short of length at the batsman, stays back and defends
a bouncer this time, 137.4kph, Mithun ducks under easily
length on the stumps, Mithun was stuck on the back foot, the ball hits the inner half and goes towards fine leg
Southee goes short as well, but the line is outside off, Tamim jumps in the air and helps it over the slips
length around off, stays back and leg side, pushes it towards covers for a quick single
short of length near the rib cage, takes the bottom hand off and dabs it to the left of the keeper
short but too high and outside off, Tamim ducks as it flies to the keeper
length outside off, angling in, Tamim lets it go through to the keeper
length around off, stays in the crease and taps it towards cover
short of length but down the leg side, Mithun moves inside the line of the ball
short of length around off this time, moves back and across and drops it down at his feet with the bottom hand coming off
short again, right at the batsman this time who was late to react this time but somehow manages to get under
under short one, near the rib cage, Mithun stays back and defends it towards short leg

goes for the pull and that's taken by a tumbling Watling down the leg side, Mithun has reviewed though. It was short of length down the leg side, Mithun decided to pull it this time, was late on the shot, misses and the ball brushes the elbow guard, it seems, on the way to the keeper

Wagner gets his man, just like the last time. Short of length outside off this time, Mithun was on the back foot, looking to get over the bounce and drop it down but it doesn't rise as much as Mithun expected. Gets an inside edge and Watling gobbles it again
full, angling across to off stump, and Tamim starts the session with a crisp drive. Mid-off moves a few yards to his right to cut it off
and again, full on off stump. Another firm drive, this time straight to mid-off
full once more, on middle and off. Whipped away to the left of mid-on, off the inside half of the bat. Slightly snatched at that drive

ooh, off the mark with an edged boundary. Lovely delivery, pitching in line with the stumps and forcing Soumya to play. Fullish length, but he's only half forward, and a bit of away movement off the seam finds his edge. Only two slips in place, though, and the ball shoots away to the left of the diving second slip fielder
in the blockhole on off stump, jams his bat down to keep it out
fullish, close to off stump, blocked into the covers
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on for the soft-hands push into the cover point region
shortish waist-high ball on off stump. Shuffles across and whips towards long leg

Wagner strikes again, and he gets the big wicket with another short ball. Gets up to just about stomach height, and Tamim ends up cramped for room as he looks to pull. Ends up as more of a flick than a pull, and the ball balloons up for Southee to take a simple catch at square leg
short, angling across to off stump, jumps back and across to defend into the on side
another short ball, climbs up steeply at Mahmudullah as he looks to tuck it off his ribs into the leg side. Bounces extra and smacks him in the gloves
short again, middle-and-off line. Hops to ride the bounce and defend into the off side with soft hands
back of a length, slanting across to off stump, defended off the back foot into the covers
length ball angling away from off stump, left alone

ooh, loose drive. Not full enough for the shot, and the ball was angling away from him all the time. No feet either, and he has to reach out for the ball, and ends up slicing it in the air but wide of gully
back of a length, angling across to off stump, opens his bat face and steers it away, between third slip and gully. Was in control on this occasion
ooh, leaves that on length. Straightens a touch after the ball angles across to pitch on middle and off, and the ball passes over the top of off stump after Soumya leaves it
back of a length close to off stump, blocked back down the pitch
digs it in and gets it up to ribcage height just outside leg stump. Tucked away through backward square leg
back of a length, angling towards Soumya's right hip. Misses the flick and the ball clips his thigh pad, forcing the keeper to dive to his right to stop the ball from running away for leg byes
digs it in much shorter, and Soumya ducks under it
short again, angling over leg stump. Steps across to try and swat it over leg gully, but he's a little late on the shot and fails to connect
another sharply rising delivery, attacking Soumya's front hip as he steps across to try and evade it. Almost leaves his gloves in the way
shortish, straightens in the fourth-stump channel. Jabs at it and sends it rolling down to third man
boom, that is sensational. Full on off stump and he gets his front leg out of the way to shovel Henry back over his head and into the sightscreen. Wow
fullish, pitching on off stump and continuing with the angle away from the left-hander. Uncertain waft, beaten
back of a length on off stump, goes back and across to defend with soft hands, the ball rolls gently into the backward square leg region
length ball angling in towards off stump, defended to short extra-cover
back of a length, angling in to top of off. Stays leg-side of the ball to punch towards short extra-cover, went off the inner half of the bat thanks to the angle
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and defends towards backward point
shortish in the corridor and Soumya fences uncertainly at it. Extra bounce takes the shoulder of the bat and the ball runs away well wide of the lone slip fielder
short ball at Mahmudullah's left hip. Tucked away to long leg
shortish, top of middle and off. Stays leg-side of the ball to jab towards backward point
short ball angling down leg. Misses the pull after stepping across to the off side
shortish on off stump, gets on his toes to steer to square gully
bouncer angling in towards off stump. Ducks nice and low under it

beauty. Length ball angling into the fourth-stump channel and straightening past the outside edge of Mahmudullah's forward defensive. Some late away swing thereafter, just before it reaches the keeper
length ball angling in towards off stump, driven to the left of extra-cover

the short ball gets another, and Soumya has to walk back. This one, angling across to off stump, actually wasn't short enough to pull, and Soumya ends up swinging at it with an angled bat, hitting from down to up. Ends up ballooning it high in the air behind the wicket, and Watling takes it easily after moving a few yards to his right
back of a length, fourth-stump line, lets it come on and defends towards gully
length ball on off stump, defended back towards the bowler
back of a length, angling into off stump. Gets on his toes and defends towards gully
back of a length on middle and leg, jumps across to defend into the on side with a straight bat
another short ball, this time angling across the right-hander and rising over off stump. Does well to drop his hands under the ball and sway his upper body away from the line
length ball slanting away from off stump, the fullest Wagner has bowled in a while, Left alone
shortish, rising up to chest height on off stump. Jumps across to defend from an awkward, open position
shortish on off stump, hops across to defend towards short cover
big appeal, not given. Wagner's short ball continues to cause problems here. Mahmudullah tries to drop his hands below the ball, and there's a big shout for caught behind as the ball zips past him
full outside off, and Liton steps forward into a flowing drive to the left of cover
nice length, finds a bit of late swing away from the fifth-stump channel. Left alone
fullish, angling in towards off stump, blocked back to the bowler. Bat sliced slightly across the line in defence
shortish on off stump, defended towards backward point
big appeal as Henry gets this one to nip back in and ping Liton's front pad as he plays half-forward in defence. Extra bounce, though, and it looked quite certain to go over the top of the stumps
back of a length, angling into off and middle. Defended towards midwicket
short ball gets up to stomach height on about off stump. Mahmudullah can't free his arms to pull, ends up playing a short-arm flick in the air, but in the gap at forward square leg
back of a length on off stump, nicely back and across to defend into the covers
bouncer over leg stump, Liton gets his head across and his body down low to evade it
nasty. That's short, angling across the right-hander, but then it straightens in off the pitch even as Liton looks to sway away from the line. Smacks him flush in the helmet grille
another short ball, rising over off stump this time. Ducks down low to evade it
length ball on middle and off, defended back towards the bowler
full, angling into middle stump. Gets his front leg out of the way and defends into the covers
back of a length close to off stump, punched firmly and stylishly to extra-cover
ooh, loose shot. Noiwhere near full enough for the cover drive, and it beats the outside edge of his angled bat
full on middle stump, clipped to the right of mid-on
back of a length, angling into middle stump, defended back towards the bowler
length ball close to off stump,lets it come on and blocks into the point region
rib-cage ball on middle stump. Jumps across to defend into the on side
short again, on leg stump, hops across and blocks into the on side
shortish stomach-high ball on middle and leg, defended towards short leg
ouch, now it's Mahmudullah's turn to wear one on the helmet. On the badge, pretty much, as he semi-ducks into one that doesn't climb as high as he expected
short again, rising over off stump. Makes room and tries to uppercut, but can't connect
back of a length, angling across to off stump. Lets it come on and dabs it gently behind point
low full-toss on off stump, and it's driven firmly towards mid-off, where Boult, moving a step to his left, lets the ball slip past him, slightly awkward bounce
back of a length on off stump, defended towards backward point, who flings a powerful throw at the non-striker's end and nearly concedes four overthrows - smart work from the man backing up at mid-on
back of a length outside off, defended towards backward point
length ball on middle and off, blocked back to the bowler
shortish just outside off stump and Mahmudullah rises to his toes, stays leg-side of the ball, and punches into the gap to the left of backward point
lovely delivery, fullish but not a half-volley, inviting the cover drive, and beating the edge with late outswing
shortish, angling across to off stump, lets it come on and steers it past the right hand of the diving slip fielder
short again, hops back and across to defend and gets a thick inside-edge onto his pads
length ball slanting away from off stump, jumps back and across to defend back down the pitch
that big back-and-across jump again, and Wagner extracts some extra bounce to open up Mahmudullah. Rises up to hit his glove, but he plays it close to his body and keeps it down towards gully

gone, Wagner is causing all kinds of discomfort here. Mahmudullah has been jumping back and across at everything, and this one isn't all that short. It's angling across towards off stump, and it stops on the batsman a little. Ends up playing a nothing flick at it, and popping the simplest of catches to square leg
length around off and middle, defended from the crease
floated around off, comes forward and drives it through covers, didn't try to hit it too hard
crunched! Squarer this time, fuller outside off, gets down on one knee and hits it through cover for back to back fours
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards mid-off
third boundary of the over. Short of length outside, backs away and steers it past gully, not as confident as those two gorgeous cover drives though
length around off, stays back and defends it towards backward point
short of length outside off, goes for the pull but doesn't get hold of it, luckily it falls towards the vacant deep backward square leg area, Wagner from fine leg comes across to pick it up
length but down the leg side, goes for the flick but too far away from him
back of length around off, almost getting Taijul jumping who defends it on the off side
short again, this time in the line of the body, tucked away past leg slip for one
a bouncer, pitching around leg and angling across, Liton ducks under quite comfortably
another bouncer, this time a bit too high, Liton gets under it easily
short of length around off, stays back and dabs it towards third man
short of length outside off, a short-arm pull towards deep square leg
length around off, stays back and defends
beaten! Short of length outside off, goes for the cut and misses
short of length outside off, Taijul pushes at it, gets a thick outside edge past the tumbling second slip
short of length around off, moves across towards the off side, gets behind the line and offers a solid defence
length outside off, and going away from the batsman, left alone
short of length around off, doesn't bounce as much and hits near the shoulder of the bat and goes between wide first slip and gully
short outside off, looks to pull but misses
short of length down the leg side and Watling takes it one-handed diving down the leg side, a loud appeal for caught-behind. Not out, says the umpire. Came off the top of the thigh pad
short of length down the leg side, moves inside the line and looks to flick, beaten
short of length again, tucked away towards square leg
short of length outside off, backs away and slaps it square off the wicket for four
short of length outside off, goes for the pull, gets a top edge towards third man
dropped?! Did that carry? No, just fell short. Short of length down the leg side, goes for the pull but fails to keep it down, Ross Taylor at leg slip dives low to his right, but it lands just short
a bouncer but Taijul ducks under easily
short of length around off, defended on the off side
short of length around off, goes for the cut, a thick outside edge goes past first slip
length but way down the leg side, no shot attempted
short of length, but down the leg side, ignored
short of length at the batsman who goes deep and defends it towards short leg
fuller around off, clips it nicely but straight towards square leg
short of length around off, almost 134kph, gets underneath it easily
short of length around off, 136.8kph, steered towards gully where Williamson throws himself low to his right to stop it
falls just short of Raval at square leg, another short ball around off, Taijul goes for the pull but cannot keep it down, and the ball lobs towards square leg where Raval was a bit late to react
goes for the short one but too high, called a wide
short of length around off, stays back and drops at down, struck on the glove though, fingers of the right hand. Physio is out to tend to him
another short one, angling across the batsman who stays away from it
short of length around off, defended towards point from the back foot, Liton is still facing some discomfort with his hand
short of length outside off, steers it towards gully
another bouncer on the stumps, Liton ducks under but the umpire thinks that's one too many for the over and calls no-ball, 200 comes up for Bangladesh
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards extra cover, Boult dives to his right to intercept it
short of length around middle and leg, defended from the back foot
length outside off, nice carry to the keeper as Taijul leaves it alone
fuller around off, comes forward and looks to drive through covers, mistimes it on the leg side
short of length outside off, stays away from it
short of length outside off, 135.7kph, looks to pull but is late on the shot, gets beaten
length ball on the stumps, stays back and defends
fuller on the off stumps, looks to drive, mistimes it towards short midwicket
short of length around middle and leg, defended on the off side
short of length and pulled away behind square, rolling the wrists over it, in complete control, beats the man at deep square leg
another short one and another pull, this time towards fine leg, only a single
short of length outside off, lets it go through
fuller and wider outside off, goes for the cut but misses
short of length outside off, Taijul looks to duck under but this anyway is way outside off
back of length on the stumps, dabbed in front of square
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards point
a sharp bouncer on middle and leg, Taijul does well to duck under

trapped in front, Taijul though has reviewed it. Fuller on middle and leg, Taijul was moving towards the off side, looks to flick and misses. Nothing on the HotSpot or Snikco. It pitched around middle, hit in front of leg and would have gone on to hit the leg stump. It stays out and Bangladesh lose their review
fuller on the pads, goes for the flick and misses, this one was heading down though
fuller around off, Mustafizur was hoping for it to move away and therefore shoulders arms, but it keeps coming in with the angle and clatters into the off stump to the batsman's horror
short of length around middle and leg, pulled down towards deep-backward square leg
a bouncer angling across the batsman but too short, called a wide
length outside off, left alone
length around off, almost squaring up the batsman, an outside edge towards point
short of length around off, stays back and steers it towards point
length outside off, stays back and opens the face of the bat to run it down, but ends up hitting it straight to Williamson at gully. Southee gets his first wicket as well
fuller around off, pushes at it and gets beaten as it moves away from the batsman
fuller on the stumps, Jayed is stuck in his crease but manages to get his bat in front of the ball
short of length around off, Jayed bends a bit and looks to ramp it over, misses
fuller around off, stands tall and drives it past the non-striker, holds his pose as well, as the ball races towards the long-off boundary
almost a yorker on the stumps, Jayed was backing away but gets his bat down in time to keep it out
length around middle and leg, was backing away but ends up defending in the end
fuller on the stumps, backs away and looks to smash it on the off side, misses and Boult hits
fullish outside off, left alone
full, angling into the pads, clipped to the left of long leg
back of a length on off stump, defended into the on side
back of a length, wider outside off this time, left alone
full, a bit of swing in towards the left-hander's off stump. Driven firmly back to the bowler

beauty. Length ball, angling into the fourth-stump channel and straightening off the seam. Latham comes forward to defend, and the ball slides past his outside edge. Did well to play close to his body and not follow the movement
back of a length on leg stump, defended back towards the bowler
bouncer, goes through to the keeper at gentle pace after Raval sways away from the line
good ball, shortish and straightening late over the top of the stumps. Raval leaves it on length, raising his arms high over his head
length ball swerving late into middle and off, Raval is in position early, and he waits until it's right under his eyes to defend into the off side
full on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
back of a length, looks to leave on length again, and the late movement back into him causes the ball to hit his back thigh

ooh, good ball. Back of a length, some seam back into Latham, who's stuck on the crease, playing hurriedly across the line to catch up with the ball. Beats the inside edge and hits the front thigh pad
back of a length, fifth-stump line, left alone. This one leaves the batsman off the seam
pretty good bowling so far this over. A fuller length than the previous ball, in the fourth-stump channel, and Latham gets on the front foot and has a close look before electing to leave it
back of a length. slightly wider, left alone
fullish, angling into off stump, clipped neatly into the on side and Mominul dives right to cut it off at midwicket
back of a length, close to off stump, lets it come on and blocks towards backward point

big appeal for lbw but this is pitching outside leg, surely. Looks to defend, showing the full face of the bat, and this nipped in off the seam to beat the inside edge. Lots of bounce too, so height may have also been an issue
back of a length, slants across into the corridor and straightens a touch. Raval leaves it alone
back of a length, this one keeps going away with the angle away from off stump. Left alone
back of a length, curves back in towards off stump to cramp Raval for room. Lets it come on and defends into the point region
back of a length, leg-stumpish, tucked off the hip towards square leg
bouncer, slants away from off stump and Raval can evade it comfortably, crouching down low
after an impressive second over, Jayed begins his third with a half-volley on the pads, and Latham clips it away elegantly to the left of midwicket
length ball wide of off stump, swinging away further, left alone
some inswing on this occasion, a full ball that's nearly in the blockhole, on middle stump. Keeps his front pad out of the way and blocks to mid-off

big appeal, and umpire Palliyaguruge says not out. Excellent delivery, angling in and straightening towards off stump from a good length. Latham is stuck on the crease and hit on the back leg. Looks close on replay too - not sure why Bangladesh didn't review this. Height may be an issue. It is, according to Hawkeye, which says it's comfortably missing the top of off
and again, angles in before nipping away off the seam. Shorter and in the corridor, and Latham pokes and misses

gone, what a great sequence of deliveries this is. Again some seam away from the left-hander, but this time he pitches it full and outside off stump, enticing the drive away from the body. Latham obliges, and sends a thin edge to Liton Das behind the stumps. The length was just perfect, because it was full without being a half-volley, and there was just enough of distance between where the ball pitched and where it met Latham's edge for it to move that small, lethal amount
zips past the edge again. Back of a length from over the wicket, pitching on leg stump and jagging away considerably to beat the back-foot defensive
full on the pads, clipped to deep backward square leg
ooh, full and curving away late in the fourth-stump channel. Good leave from Williamson
full again, angling into off stump. Brings his bat down beautifully straight to drive to mid-off
fullish, close to off stump, and that's nicely done. Good stretch forward to block it a few yards to the left of mid-off and pick up a quick single to get off the mark
length ball pitching on off stump and continuing with the angle away, left alone
full and close to off stump, driven crisply to mid-off
stays back to a fairly full ball on off stump, squeezes it out to backward point with an open face
fullish, fifth-stump line, left alone
full in the channel, a bit of swing away from Williamson. Drives a little early and gets a thick inside edge into his pad
back of a length on off stump, gets back and across and clips towards midwicket
length ball outside off, left alone, a bit of nip back but it started wide enough to not worry Williamson too much
ooh, extra bounce. Back of a length, angling across towards off stump. Looks to defend off the back foot and it takes off and hits him on the back elbow. Ouch
and now he slides one past the edge. Back of a length, lands it on off and middle with the seam upright, and it sneaks away to beat Raval's back-foot defensive
length ball, very close to off stump, but he trusts the bounce and leaves it alone
on the pads now, clipped into the backward square leg region
back of a length, and it jags back in with extra bounce to beat Williamson's hopping back-foot defensive and hit him on the stomach
shortish in the fifth-stump channel. Jumps to ride the bounce and punches into the covers
excellent leave. The angle was inward, from round the wicket, and the length was on the fuller side of a good length,and it leaves Raval off the seam to end up a foot or so outside off stump
length ball, a little straighter, gets on the front foot to block it back down the pitch

spoons it, and Jayed has sent back both openers! Full outside off, looked like a driving length, but it's stopped on the batsman and left him ever so slightly, and he's hit it uppishly and straight to the man at cover

what a start. Full outside off, and Taylor's batting outside his crease so this turns into even more of a half-volley. Taylor leans his weight into the drive at the perfect moment to send it scudding away wide of mid-off
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
full again, some width on this occasion, and Taylor's bat flashes down like a scimitar to drive this to the cover point boundary
length ball in the fifth-stump channel, left alone
ooh, that's a lot of seam movement back into the right-hander. Lots of bounce too, and it roars over the top of off stump after Williamson leaves it
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Steps neatly back and across to tuck it through square leg
in the blockhole on off stump, some late inswing too, and Taylor pulls his front leg away from the line and jams down to dig it out towards mid-on
shortish, angling into off stump. The angle and extra bounce open Taylor up but he plays close to his body so the ball stays down in the point region despite hitting him on the gloves
back of a length, angling down leg, Williamson misses the glance, or gets a tiny tickle of glove on it, but the more significant contact is off thigh pad and it rolls away to the fine leg boundary

shot, and that's excellent fielding at gully. Not particularly short or wide, but it doesn't need to be for Taylor to play that trademark square cut of his. Gully dives full-length to his right to stop the fierce hit, however
back of a length, closer to off stump, defended into the cover point region
length ball angling down leg. Plays around his front pad to work it towards fine leg. Off pad only, the umpire signals
shortish, close to off stump, gets back and across to defend it back to the bowler
length ball nipping in towards off stump, clipped into the midwicket region
length ball close to off stump, Williamson defends with soft hands, almost behind his body, and the ball hits his downward-tilted bat face and runs away to the third man boundary
back of a length, extra bounce in the corridor, and Taylor goes at it with hard hands. An angled-bat punch, and the thick edge flies away to the right of second slip
Taylor's going for his shots today. This is barely a short ball, just short of a good length on off stump, and Taylor plays a bottom-handed whip-pull to the right of the tumbling mid-on fielder
length ball close to off stump, lets it come on and drops it into the point region with soft hands
wide length ball, left alone
back of a length, fourth-stump line, jumps back and across to block it back to the bowler
back of a length again, a touch wider, punched to backward point
length ball angling down leg. Misses the flick, and the ball clips his thigh pad on the way to the keeper Liton, who fumbles after moving left to concede leg-byes
shortish, angles into the batsman's hip and Williamson puts it away easily, tucking it away to the fine leg boundary, a long way to the right of the fielder on the rope
length ball straightening towards middle stump. Williamson plays back and defends, showing the full face, careful not to close his bat face and expose the leading edge

beauty. Late movement in the corridor from the shorter side of a good length, and extra bounce too. Williamson doesn't really get forward or back, just shuffles a half-step and pokes at it, and is lucky not to edge it
fuller now, fourth-stump line. Nice smooth stride forward to defend into the cover point region
well bowled, a fullish length slightly wider outside off stump, asking the batsman to go for the drive away from his body. Williamson resists the temptation and leaves it alone
short and wide, perhaps too wide for Taylor to cut. Reaches out for the shot and fails to connect
back of a length, a bit of inward movement towards middle and off to cramp Taylor, who lets it come on and clips it watchfully, on top of the bounce, to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, gets back and across to turn that to midwicket

ooh, not short or wide enough for the cut. Taylor is capable of cutting even those balls, but it nips in slightly with extra bounce and hits high on the bat, on the sticker, and bounces down into the pitch, just behind him
back of a length close to off stump, and Taylor isn't sure whether to play or leave. Decides late to defend, and meets the ball almost behind his body. Ball rolls down towards the slips
a touch too straight now, similar length to the previous two balls, and Taylor tucks it away to long leg

is that a drop? Looks like it. Fullish outswinger wide of off, continues to leave the batsman late as he reaches out to drive. Ends up hitting it in the air, to the left of Mahmudullah at short extra-cover, and it's at catchable height as he dives but he can't hold on
wow. Shortish in the corridor, and it takes off and zips past the edge as Taylor shapes to punch off the back foot

another drop! This one's a harder chance, Shadman Islam diving to his left from second slip, in front of first slip, and it's dying as it reaches him, but he gets both hands to it. Lovely length in a tight fourth-stump channel, and Taylor has a little push at it
length ball on off stump, gets across and defends into the on side
fullish on off stump, stops on Taylor slightly as he looks to punch down the ground. The shot hangs in the air briefly, but out of reach of the bowler and to his right

goes wider of the crease and angles this one in sharply towards off stump. It's quite full, but Taylor doesn't really get a stride in to drive, just throws an angled bat at it, aiming into the covers. The angle nearly does him in, but a thick inside edge onto his back pad saves him
back of a length outside off, a bit of nip back in. Williamson hops to ride the bounce and punch into the covers, and ends up hitting it to mid-on off the inside half of the bat
bouncer, angling a little down leg. Williamson ducks down low to get under it
short, wide, and Williamson rocks back and across to cut it away fiercely between cover point and backward point
short again, not as much width, slapped to deep point
now he feeds Taylor with a short one outside off and he hacks it away for another single to deep point
shortish, angling into off stump so not as much width, chopped to the man at cover point
now it's Jayed's turn to bowl short and wide, and this is such a gift for Taylor, who cuts it away powerfully to the right of gully
much fuller now, angling into a fourth-stump line, jabbed to short extra-cover
shortish again, plenty of width. Throws his bat at it and slashes it away between second slip and gully
length ball angling in towards off stump, much better line and length, clipped watchfully towards mid-on

ooh, interesting. Taylor takes a couple of steps down the pitch before the bowler releases, and he sends one down the leg side in the attempt to cramp Taylor for room. Aims to whip over square leg, can't connect
length ball angling into middle stump, defended into the on side

ooh, streaky. Shortish, angling away into the sixth-stump channel, and he gets some extra bounce. Williamson goes for the back-foot drive, away from his body, and sends a thick edge flying between second slip and gully

past the edge. Wobbly seam, lands on a good length, angles this across the stumps, pitches on about middle and off and forces Williamson to play. A little bit of away movement too. Doesn't push at it, though, keeps bat close to body, and allows it to zip past his edge
once again, angling away from off stump, and this time Williamson leaves it alone
back of a length, a bit of seam movement away from Williamson, pitching within the stumps and drawing him into playing at the ball. Pulls his bat away at the last moment
back of a length outside off, gets across and defends to backward point
short of a length close to off stump, Williamson gets back and across to defend, the ball slides off the outer half of the bat and runs away past gully
length ball angling into off stump, defended towards mid-on
fullish outside off, driven to mid-off
fullish, angling into middle and leg, Taylor clips it to the right of midwicket
shortish, not too far outside off stump. Lets it come on and chops down on top of the bounce to steer it to the right of gully and into the big gap to the left of deep point
on the fuller side of a good length, fifth-stump line, left alone

well bowled. Late swing from a good length, going away from a middle-and-off line. Williamson plays the initial angle, looking to clip towards midwicket, and is opened up, sends a leading edge rolling into the point region

and Williamson sends one running away between first and second slip. Back of a length, and again Mustafizur's line makes him hesitate between playing and leaving. Defends late, close to his body, and that ensures the edge drops down into the turf, between the two diving slips
back of a length, a touch wider, left alone
extra bounce from just short of a good length, and Williamson defends nice and close to his body, causing the ball to bounce down a few feet away from him and climb high over the gully fielder
ooh, beauty. Back of a length, angling across Taylor. Pitches on off and middle or thereabouts and leaves him a touch with some extra lift. Taylor pokes at it and misses
length ball pitching just outside leg and angling across towards middle and off, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length, finishing around off stump, jumps back and across to clip it away to the right of midwicket
length ball angling in towards off stump, defended towards midwicket off the front foot
ooh, plays around his front pad there. That's how he was out in the first Test. Shuffles across to a length ball angling into middle stump, and works it away to long leg
shortish, too close to off stump for Williamson's trademark late chop to third man. Meets it behind his body and hits it to second slip on the bounce
nice length outside off, angling in from wide of the crease, left alone
back of a length, a bit of width, leans back and looks to steer past gully with an open face, can't beat the fielder
goes wide of the crease again, angles this in towards middle and leg, stays back and clips to midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, defended towards short extra-cover
length ball angling across to middle stump. Taylor is playing Mustafizur with an open stance, so he can bring his bat down straight, uninterrupted by front pad, and defend to midwicket
short, wide, cuts it hard but too close to backward point, where Mominul tumbles to his left to stop it
well bowled, not as short but a little wider, trying to entice Taylor into chasing this. Taylor ignores it

well bowled. Length ball angling across towards off stump, and Taylor's open stance makes him play across the line in defence, bat coming down from gully towards midwicket, and he sends a thick edge running towards backward point
full outside off, overpitched, and Taylor opens his bat face and plays a lovely square drive to the right of the diving backward point fielder
back of a length outside off, chopped away to deep point

lovely shot. Full, angling into off stump, and Taylor brings his bat down beautifully straight, showing the full face, and punches it back down the ground, ramrod straight, and umpire Palliyaguruge does well to jump up and over the ball as it hurtles towards him
length ball angling down leg, misses the flick and the ball rolls off his pad into the square leg region
nice length, full but not a half-volley and pitching in the fifth-stump channel. Williamson ignores the bait
length ball angling in towards off stump, delivered from wider on the crease. Williamson stays back and defends nice and late, towards gully
back of a length, angling into middle stump, tucked away to long leg
back of a length, pitching on off stump and continuing to slant away, left alone
stays back to a length ball close to off stump, defends into the covers and pulls his top hand off the handle after playing the shot - more signs of the injury in that region
length ball, angles a little further away from off stump, left alone
back of a length, slanting away from off stump, left alone
shortish, not too far outside off, Williamson trusts the length and angle and pulls his bat out of the way
fullish, angling in towards off stump, stays on the back foot and defends right under his eyes
back of a length, tight on off stump, Taylor still finds a way to cut that away to the left of deep point
overpitched outside off, gets on the front foot to ease a drive to the left of short cover

shortish, angling in sharply from wide of the crease. Taylor wants to let it go down the leg side, lifts his bat out of the way. The ball hits his thigh pad and runs away to the boundary but no shot was offered and the umpire signals dead ball
shortish outside off, chopped away to deep point
length ball, not too far outside off stump, Williamson judges the line nicely - he's been taking guard on off stump - and leaves it alone
back of a length close to off stump, defends close to his body and the ball hits the inside half of his bat and then his back pad
length around off, dabs it towards gully
length around middle and leg, comes forward and defends
fuller outside off, comes forward and drives it towards deep extra cover
short of length in the rib cage, gets back and dabs it towards square leg, extra bounce their for Mustafizur
fuller in the channel, Williamson lets it go
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards cover, straight to the fielder though
length outside off, Taylor goes back and cuts it towards third man
fuller length outside off, nips back in off the surface but well away from the stumps, Williamson lets it go through
length, much closer to the stumps this time, Williamson waits on the back foot and defends it down the wicket
length around off, Williamson rises with the bounce and looks to turn it towards square leg, ends up hitting it on to his thigh, no short leg in place though
short of length, some room outside off this time, and Williamson doesn't miss out, cuts it past the diving gully fielder, 100 is up for New Zealand
length ball around middle, angling in, Williamson moves towards the off side and glances it fine, bat, thigh and races away towards the fine leg boundary
length ball angling across, left alone by Taylor
fuller around off, driven firmly but straight to the cover fielder
short of length this time, Taylor goes for the pull but is not in the right position, ends up mistiming it to the right of short midwicket. The partnership is now 100
short of length outside off, stays back, gets on his toes and dabs it towards gully

short of length, angling away from the batsman, Williamson goes back and pulls it from outside off in front of square leg, first runs in front of the wicket on the leg side. That's 50 as well for Williamson
short of length on the body, goes back and defends, the top hand comes off, grimace on the face. He's in some pain
length ball on the pads, a forward leg glance to fine leg to bring up his half-century
length around off, nips back in to beat Williamson who was on the back foot once again, hits him high on the back though, an appeal for lbw but not out
length around off, dabs it near the pitch on the off side, great calling from Taylor who puts in the dive to sneak in a single
length outside off, comes forward and pushes it towards gully
length around off, once again nips back in to beat the bat, Taylor this time. Once again a bit high and maybe a bit leg-side-ish as well
length around middle and moving in, Taylor is watchful this time and defends it under his eyes
short of length outside off, pushes it towards covers for a quick single

short of length around off, goes for the cut, slashing hard but it's not that wide, gets an outside edge that flies to the right of the keeper who dives sideways but cannot reach there. First slip is too wide
a touch fuller on the pads, Taylor takes a step forward and across and whips it in front of square, all the way for a six
length around off, coming back in a bit off the seam, goes for the cut but ends up chopping it towards extra cover
length around off, Taylor once again goes for the cut but it's way too close, chops it behind the stumps
fuller on the stumps, Taylor once again moves forward and across and clips it towards deep midwicket boundary, all along the ground this time
length around off, comes forward and blocks
length outside off, width as well, Williamson goes for the cut and misses, not that short to cut
length around off, stays in his crease and defends right under his eyes
fuller length around off, comes forward and offers another solid defence
length ball in the corridor, left alone this time
fuller outside off, Williamson looks to drive away from the body, the ball takes an outside edge and flies over the gully fielder
length ball around off, Taylor stays back and punches it towards short midwicket
short of length on the stumps, goes back and drags it towards midwicket
short of length outside off, stays back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
short of length outside off, goes back and steers it towards backward point
length ball, angled in on the stumps, punched towards extra cover off the back foot
length ball, a bit round-arm this time, on middle and leg, defended from the back foot
short of length around off, not much room but Taylor opens the face to run it past gully, sweeper cover cuts it off but the batsmen complete three
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards cover
fuller on the stumps, stays in his crease and defends it on the leg side with a straight-ish bat
back of length around off, angling in a bit, defended from the crease
back of length around off, leaves it alone
length ball outside off, in the corridor, Williamson leaves it alone again
length around off, flatter, punched towards extra cover off the back foot
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
length around off, goes back and away to give himself some room, forces it towards the right of sweeper cover
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards deep point
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and plays it towards mid-on with soft hands
length around off, Williamson comes forward, not to the pitch of the ball, pushes it towards short cover
length around off, comes forward and defends it towards covers
fuller outside off, comes forward and drives it towards sweeper cover
length around off, plays it towards covers with soft hands, Taylor comes across for a quick single
length around off and middle, stays back and turns it towards square leg
length outside off, goes for the cut but the gully fielder makes a diving stop to his right
fuller around off, in Taylor's half who plants his front foot across and smashes it over the bowler's head, one bounce and over the long-on boundary
length around off, not too much room, Williamson was back to cut it away, sees the extra bounce and stops half-way through the shot, an outside edge goes over first slip
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards mid-off
short of length outside off, goes back and away and punches it towards cover
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it past cover, sweeper comes across to field but Taylor is quick spot the second the run and completes it comfortably
length ball on middle and leg, stays back and defends
fuller on the stumps, plays inside out towards mid-off
another half volley and Taylor treats it in the same way, planting his front foot across and lofting it over long-on. This time it lands on the grass bank
on the leg side this time, length ball on middle and leg and Taylor lofts it towards the vacant midwicket region, dribbles over the boundary line. He is on 85 off 83 now
length around off, comes forward and defends
an attempted bouncer, doesn't rise much but down the leg side, Taylor was looking to play at it initially but leaves it alone in the end
short of length outside off, not much room, Taylor goes for the cut but ends up chopping it into the ground
length outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover for one
length ball on the pads, looks to glance, the ball brushes the pads and rolls towards short fine leg
fuller on the stumps, lunges forward and pushes it back
quicker one on to the stumps, Williamson was on the back foot, defends it towards covers, Taylor was looking for a single but Williamson was ball-watching, sends him back in time though
fuller around off and driven towards mid-off
pitched up once again, lunges forward and pushes it back
use of feet this time but gets too close to the ball, digs it out towards mid-off for a quick single
short of length outside off, stays back and cuts it towards gully, the fielder throws himself to his left to stop it
short of length outside off, rises with the bounce and cuts it down towards sweeper cover
fuller around off, Taylor stands tall and drives it to the left of mid-off, moves into the 90s
short and wide and Taylor latches on to it, cuts it hard behind point and moves to 94
short of length around off, stays in his crease and defends on the off side
length around off, comes forward and pushes it towards extra cover
length on middle and leg, goes back and whips it towards midwicket
down the track to this length ball on the stumps and lofts it over long-on for a six, lot of bottom hand in that

and gone! Ends up chipping this fuller delivery back towards the bowler who takes an easy catch. Looked like he was looking to work it towards long-on but the ball held up a little. No hundred for Williamson
length ball on the stumps, goes deep and defends
length around off, once again defended from the back foot
flatter this time, just around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball on the pads, comes forward and dabs it towards square leg
fuller around off, comes forward and looks to drive, the ball goes towards square leg off the inner half
length around off, nips back in sharply, a bit of inside edge on to the abdomen, a single as the ball rolls on the off side
short of length outside off, goes for the cut but extra bounce beats him
short of length around off, hops back and across to dab it towards square leg
fuller around off, goes for the drive but gets a thick outside edge, one bounce to the point fielder
length ball around middle, comes forward and defends
gets to his hundred in some style. Hundred No. 18 for Ross Taylor. Skips down the track and lofts it over long-on for his third six of the innings. Goes past Martin Crowe's tally
length around off, comes forward and defends it towards covers
length on middle and leg, stays back and glances it towards short fine leg
length on middle and leg, comes forward and defends
short of length on the stumps, goes back and works it towards long-on
length around off, looks to defend from the crease, an inside edge on to the body
fuller on the off stump, drives it towards mid-on
length around off, stays back and defends it down the wicket
short of length around off, goes for the cut, up and over the slip cordon, too close to the body but looked like it was intentional from Nicholls
short of length around off, defends it on the off side
short and wide, poor from Mustafizur, Nicholls cuts it aerially in front of square. Looked like a slower one. The ball stops just near the deep extra cover boundary
short of length on the stumps, goes back and pulls it towards deep square leg
fuller around off, comes forward and defends
fuller on the stumps, works it towards long-on for an easy single
length ball, angled across, goes back and defends it towards the bowler
a touch fuller but Nicholls once again goes deep and blocks
fuller on the stumps, clips it towards short midwicket from the front foot
length around off, just leaving the batsman who shoulders arms
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and drives it back, Mustafizur stops it in his followthrough
fuller around off, comes forward and defends it towards cover
length but way outside off and leaving the batsman, ignored
beauty, length around middle and leaving the batsman who ended up pushing at it, the only thing missing was an outside edge
a sharp bouncer aimed at the batsman, Taylor does well to sway away from it
starts by sliding one down the leg side, too far from Nicholls' attempted whip
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
short and wide, slashed away to the third man boundary to bring up New Zealand's 200. Big gap between backward point and second slip
short outside off once more, slapped to backward point
full on leg stump, clipped to long leg

length ball angling in towards off stump, and Taylor goes for the big hit over the bowler's head. Ends up slicing it a little, over mid-off and well out of his reach as he turns around and runs towards the boundary
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, gets back and across to defend into the on side
fullish, angling in towards off stump, defended into the point region
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and plays a straight-bat push towards mid-on
in the blockhole on middle and leg, gets his front leg out of the way and blocks into the on side
short, shoulder-high ball outside off, Taylor plays a tennis smash down to long-on
short and wide, too much bounce for Taylor to negotiate as he reaches out to slash, can't put bat to ball
back of a length, straightens a touch towards off stump as Nicholls shapes to cut, cramps him for room. Adjusts late to jam his bat down in defence
fullish on off stump, punched down to mid-on
length ball wide of off stump, goes deep in his crease and across with his back foot to manufacture a slash well wide of the lone slip fielder. New Zealand move into the lead
short outside off, a bit of seam movement away from Nicholls to beat his attempted cut
length ball wide of off stump, some late swing away after Nicholls leaves the ball
length ball angling in towards off stump, punched back to the bowler
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the off side
fullish, angling in towards off stump, blocked towards mid-off

big appeal for lbw as Taylor looks to pull one that isn't short enough for the shot. Hits him on the back thigh pad, not given. Looked to be a touch too high, and was the impact in line with off stump? We'll know soon, since Bangladesh have reviewed. No bat on it. Umpire's call on impact, but it's easily bouncing over the top of the stumps
back of a length, angling in towards leg stump. Lets it come on and tucks it gently into the square-leg region
length ball angling into off stump, defended towards mid-on
and immediately past the edge. Lovely line, pitching on off stump or thereabouts, and slanting away from the left-hander, who only gets half-forward and jabs away from his body
fullish, angling into off stump from wide of the crease, clipped away through midwicket
back of a length, angling into middle stump, tucked away to deep square leg
short and wide, and Nicholls slashes and misses. Possibly some seam movement away from the bat, and certainly some extra bounce
shortish, angling in towards a fourth-stump line. Shuffles across to try and work it leg-side, but he can only play it back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, defended into the point region
short, gets up to shoulder height on off stump, swivels round to pull to deep square leg
full, angling across to off stump, driven to mid-off
full again, a little wider. Drives a little early and sends it rolling to mid-off rather than through the covers as he may originally have intended
short, wide, slapped to deep point
fullish, pitching on off stump and continuing to slant away. Not a great stride out in defence, and a thick edge runs away to the left of the diving slip fielder
full, just outside off, and now Taylor sends an edge racing away to the third man boundary. Straightens a touch and he drives with hard hands, well in front of his body
in the blockhole on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
round the wicket, shortish ball in the fifth-stump channel. Hops back and across to defend towards backward point
back of a length, fourth-stump line, defended off the back foot into the on side
length ball angling in towards off stump, looks to defend from the crease and gets a thick edge to backward point
full on middle stump and Nicholls clips it away crisply, into the gap to the left of mid-on. Brings up the fifty partnership too
length ball angling into the pads, clipped into the vacant midwicket region
short, rising head high over off stump, Taylor hooks - more a swat, really, with the bat coming down on top of the ball like a hammer - to deep square leg
shortish, close to off stump, brings his bottom wrist into play for a front-foot cut to deep point
back of a length on off stump, lets it come and tucks it into the vacant midwicket region to turn the strike over
fullish, angling into middle stump, clipped to midwicket
slower length ball angling into off stump. Waits on it and drops it gently, with soft hands, square on the off side
back of a length, angling into a fourth-stump line from round the wicket. Jumps back and across and nudges this wide of mid-on
short, angling towards leg stump, pulled towards deep square leg
speared in flat towards off stump, goes on the  back foot to work it through midwicket
fuller now, steps out to whip it from off stump, back to the bowler
goes on the back foot to work this leg side. The ball bounces etrra and hits his thigh pad
length ball on off stump, goes back to punch towards mid-off
tossed up slower on off stump, clipped to midwicket
full on off stump, whipped down the ground to long-on
length ball on middle stump, clipped past the left hand of the diving midwicket fielder
full, angling in towards off stump, punched to mid-on
length ball on off stump, clipped to midwicket
full outside off, gets forward to push that to the left of cover
length ball close to off stump, defended towards backward point
in the blockhole on middle and leg, clipped away to deep midwicket
tossed up wide of off stump, driven to the sweeper at deep point
goes back to a length ball on leg stump, works it away through backward square leg
goes back to a flat length ball on off stump, clips it to the left of mid-on
flat, speared in towards off stump. Not that short but Taylor makes a bit of room and cuts it away with a roll of his wrists, finds the gap to the left of backward point
flighted and full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length now, punched away towards deep point
shortish outside off, cut away towards backward point
fullish outside leg. Misses the flick and Liton goes up in appeal for caught behind after tumbling to his right. Clipped the back leg, I think
short now, leg-stumpish, swivels round to pull it to the fine leg boundary
short again, angled across to off stump now, gets up to chest height, and Nicholls pounces on it, pulls it along the ground to the square leg boundary
digs it in extremely short, angles it well wide of off stump, and it's called wide - for height more than width, I think
and Nicholls brings up fifty with his third boundary of the over. Full on off stump and he shows the full face to punch it back down the ground, just past the non-striker
another bouncer, dug in too short once more and easily clears Nicholls' head
length around off side, defends into the off side from the crease
tossed up slow on middle and leg, Taylor plays a checked inside-out drive to short extra-cover
slides this one down the leg side, Taylor misses the sweep
tossed up full outside off, and Taylor drives this beautifully, into the gap to extra-cover's left, and a long way to the right of the fielder at deep point
flat length ball wide of off, reaches out and ends up chopping it down into the ground off the bottom half of the bat
a bit of flight, steps out to drive to long-off
full on off stump, whipped through square leg
digs it in short, angling away from off stump. Goes for the slash and plays too early, hits it in the air but just out of reach of Mahmudullah diving to his right at short cover
length ball on the pads, clipped to the right of midwicket
length ball angling across to off stump, clipped away through square leg. Loud shout of 'no!' from the umpire - Mustafizur's overstepped by a couple of inches
full, almost a yorker just outside off, blocked back to the bowler
short outside off, pulled to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, defended towards short extra-cover
short, gets up to chest height over off stump, pulled to the right of deep midwicket and it's time for drinks
length ball on middle and leg, goes back and flicks it towards square leg
fuller on the stumps, goes down and paddles it fine, short fine leg chases to prevent the boundary
length around off, comes forward and pushes it back
fuller on the stumps, driven inside out towards long-off
fuller on the pads, flicks it towards deep midwicket for one
flighted outside off, drives it firmly towards extra cover, a partial stop there
flighted outside off, nicely driven towards sweeper cover for a single
flighted on the stumps, whips it towards short midwicket
short of length outside off, goes back and punches it towards deep extra cover
fuller on the pads, comes forward and works it towards midwicket
fuller on the stumps, flicks it towards short midwicket
length around off, pushes it towards short cover from the crease
length ball on the pads, flicks it towards deep midwicket
length around off, comes forward and drives it towards extra cover
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it late, towards short third man
length ball on the stumps, goes deep and pushes it towards short midwicket
fuller around off, comes forward and works it towards short midwicket once again
pitched up once more, comes forward and taps it towards the bowler
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts but straight to backward point
length ball on the stumps, punches it past short midwicket on the left
down the track but gets too close to the ball, digs it out back towards the bowler
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards short midwicket
length ball on the pads, works it in front of square for a single
length around middle, Taylor looks to flick it on the leg side, turns the face a little early, gets an outside edge towards point, 300 comes up with that single
short of length, just outside off, Taylor finds backward point with cut
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and pushes it towards the bowler
fuller around off, driven past short extra cover, long-off comes across to cut it off
length ball on the stumps, punches it towards short midwicket
fuller on the stumps, paddles it towards fine leg for a couple
and again, this time straight towards the fine leg fielder though
skips down the track, reaches to the pitch of the ball and drills it towards long-on
length ball on the stumps, taps it towards square leg
fuller around off, drives it towards long-off for one
