length ball on the stumps, punched back towards the bowler
fuller around off, skips down and hits it towards long-off, along the ground
short of length down the leg side, goes back and pulls it towards deep square leg for four, the lead has crossed 100 now
looks to paddle it away, but it's a length ball, tapped towards square leg
length around off, pushed past towards the wide long-off, sprints back for the second and that's 150 for Taylor
length around off, punched towards the bowler
goes for the sweep, takes it on the full and sweeps it towards the right of fine leg, comes back for the third
length around off, goes back and defends
length around off, goes back and taps it towards square leg
short of length down the leg side, goes back and pulls it towards fine leg
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards long-off
length ball on middle and leg, looks to push at it, ball takes the inner half and dribbles towards square leg
fuller on the stumps and Nicholls pulls out a reverse sweep this time, hits it past first slip for four
length ball on the pads, looks to whip it away, misses and gets hit on the pads
fuller around off, comes forward and drive but cannot beat the man at extra cover
fuller around off, pushed towards long-off on the front foot
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
fuller on the pads, goes down and sweeps it towards fine leg for two more. The stand is now 151
length ball on the stumps, comes forward and works it towards short midwicket
length again, on the stumps, stays and the crease and pushes it towards short midwicket
length around off, goes back and cuts it past short third man who chases to keep it to two
short of length outside off, cut towards the left of sweeper cover this time
short of length on the stumps, goes back and cuts it towards deep point
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards long-off, looking very easy at the moment
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards short midwicket
length ball on the pads, goes back and flicks it towards midwicket
length ball around off, punched off the back foot towards the bowler
length ball on the pads, goes back and flicks it towards midwicket
on the stumps, Taylor takes it on the full and laps it towards fine leg for three more
length ball on the pads, spinning away, helped behind square for one
length around off, defended from the crease
flighted around off, digs it out towards sweeper cover
fuller around off and Taylor is dispatched it over the bowler's head for a six, nonchalantly done
length around off, looks to drop it on the off side and sneak in a single, the point fielder was quick to the ball
length ball on the stumps and Taylor has clubbed it over midwicket, on the walk. One-bounce four
a bouncer this time but too high, sails over the keeper as well, five more to the total
fuller on the stumps, pushed towards long-on, wanted to come back for the second but will have to settle for one
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and pushes it towards mid-on
pitched up around off, Nicholls digs it out towards short midwicket
length around off and middle, stays in the crease and defends
a touch fuller on the stumps, punched back
fuller on the stumps, drives down the ground, the bowler comes across to stop
length around off, looks to force it square off the wicket on the off side, an inside edge into the ground
length around off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover, was late on it, the ball hits the glove and onto the bat
length ball on the stumps, turned away towards deep square leg
a low full toss on the stumps, gets down and paddles it towards fine leg
fuller around off, fetches it from outside off and laps it towards fine leg
length around off, chips it towards short extra cover, was in the air but well short of the fielder
length on middle and leg, defended towards short midwicket
fuller around off, punches it towards the bowler
short of length on the stumps, goes back and works it towards long-on
length ball on the stumps, comes forward and blocks
length ball in the stumps, pushed back once again
down the track, shortens his length, Taylor adjusts to work it towards long-on
use of feet against a fuller ball around off, whips it towards long-on
length around off, goes for the drive but a good stop by the point fielder, diving to his right
short of length outside off, chops it towards the left of point for one
fuller on the stumps, pushes it back towards the bowler

length around off, comes forward and pushes it towards extra cover
length ball on the stumps, goes back and punches it towards long-on
fuller on the stumps, digs it out towards long-on

length around off, taps it towards cover, Nicholls was looking for a single, retraces his steps in time

length ball on the stumps, comes forward and defends
fuller around off, use of feet to push it back

length around off, comes forward and drives it towards extra cover
a touch fuller and wider, driven to the right of long-off
length ball on the stumps, sweeps it towards deep-backward square leg

fuller around off, steered towards sweeper cover for one more
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it past point for three, the partnership if now 200, off just 227 balls
fuller around off, comes forward and hits it back towards the bowler
down the track and takes it on the full, looks to smash it towards midwicket but the ball dips on him, mistimed towards square leg
fuller around off, drives it towards deep extra cover for an easy single
length ball around off, skips away and cuts it towards the left of sweeper cover for two
and he gets to his 100 with a boundary, length ball on the stumps, Nicholls goes down and sweeps it over short fine leg, a couple of bounces and over the rope
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards long-off
length ball on the stumps, goes down and sweeps it towards deep square leg
fuller around off, drives it towards sweeper cover
skips down the track and looks to smash it towards midwicket, mistimes it towards square leg
fuller around off, smashes it along the ground but straight towards the bowler
a full toss on the pads, clubs it towards deep midwicket, only a single
makes a lot of room to slap a leg-stump ball to deep point
fuller, nudged away off the legs through square leg
shortish on off stump, cut to backward point, who fumbles to allow an easy single
bowled him. Looks to make room again and this time Taijul fires it flat at off stump. Nicholls has to reach out a long way to cut, and he fails to connect
length ball outside off, beats de Grandhomme's attempted angled-bat drive
short now, a bit of width, slapped hard but backward point throws himself to his right to stop the ball
full on off stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, uses the angle to work it away to the right of midwicket
fullish, angling into off stump, stays back and defends it back to the bowler
full, lots of width, de Grandhomme absolutely smashes a flat-bat drive straight to mid-off
nice length, fourth-stump line, a tiny bit of away swing before it nips back in off the pitch. Looks to dab it down to third man and gets a thick inside edge past his off stump
full now, just outside off, goes for the big hit and miscues, juuust manages to elude extra-cover turning back and running towards the boundary with his back to the batsman
short, wide, trampoline bounce to beat Taylor's back-foot slap and Liton collects over his head
back of a length, a bit of movement back in towards off stump, jumps back and across to work this towards midwicket
shortish, drags a pull through square leg from outside off stump
fullish, slanting away into a fifth-stump line. Not quite a half-volley and CDG swings and misses, looking to hit this back over the bowler's head

length ball on off stump, looks to hit over mid-off/extra-cover, and the angle forces him to slice it much squarer than intended. Goes high in the air before dropping down a few yards in front of third man
short, a bit of width, rolls his wrists over on top of the bounce to cut it to backward point
back of a length on off stump, punched firmly back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, punched towards mid-off, who's deep enough to permit a scampered single

short outside off, and that's the third Test-match double-hundred for Taylor, who shuffles across his stumps and down the pitch and drags a pull towards the square-leg boundary. What an innings this has been
short again, wider outside off this time. CdG goes for the big pull and sends a top-edge flying over the gap between keeper and wide slip
overpitched on off stump, gets his front leg out of the way and manufactures an inside-out flick to the left of mid-off
length ball wide of off stump, throws his bat at it and slices it squarer than intended, finds the backward point boundary
gone, Mustafizur gets a wicket. Back of a length, slanting away into a fifth-stump line. Clears his front leg and slogs across the line, and sends a top-edge to Liton behind the stumps
full outside off and Watling flows into a lovely drive first up, into the gap to the left of mid-off
length ball outside off, gets his weight forward to push towards point with an open-ish face
full, angling across to off stump, clears his front leg and lofts it over mid-off, not quite managing a clean connection. He's barely middled anything today, but he's batting on 22 off 15
bouncer over middle and leg, ducks down low to evade it
another bouncer, rising over CdG's right shoulder. Looks to hook but can't connect, the ball zips past too quick
full outside off, Watling drives stylishly to the left of the sweeper at deep cover point
full slower ball, dips down just outside off. Uses his wrists to clip it down to long-on
length ball, fifth-stump line. Throws his bat at an angled-bat slash and fails to connect
short, wide, stands tall and slaps it hard to deep cover

another wicket, and New Zealand have declared. Soumya Sarkar is at fly slip, some 40 yards from the bat, and Watling chases after a wide length ball and slices it pretty much straight to him, a little to his right
fuller on the pads and clipped away towards deep square leg, off the mark with a boundary
and bowled'im! Length ball around middle and off, looking to shape away but it nips back after landing, sneaks in through the bat and pad to hit the top of the leg stump
fuller around off, this one moving away, pushed tentatively towards point
back of length around off, Mominul gets behind it and blocks
fuller around off, a hint of shape away, defended from the crease
length ball, just outside off and moving away, Mominul withdraws his bat
fuller around off, swings back just a little, left alone but wasn't far away from the off stump
fuller on middle and leg, defends it towards short leg
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards mid-off
pitched up, wide outside off this time, drives it through covers for four, he's off the mark with a four as well
length but way too outside off, left alone
short of length outside off, goes for the cut but misses
back of length outside off, left alone
fuller on the stumps, clips it behind square leg for a couple, short leg fielder puts in the chase
length but down the leg side, goes for the flick but too far away
fuller around off, comes forward and defends
a bouncer this time from Boult. Mominul ducks under quite comfortably
up and over, short of length, wide outside off, Mominul cuts it over the point fielder
banged in short, at the batsman who gets underneath it
length ball on middle and leg, a bit of wobble in the air, gets his bat down just in time
length around middle, a bit of shape in, defended on the front foot
fuller around off, looks to drive down the ground but the ball swings in and takes the inner half, a couple of runs towards midwicket
fuller, a little bit of width this time, goes for a drive away from the body and gets beaten
length but way outside off, left alone
length around off, stays on the back foot and dabs it towards backward point
fuller around off and middle, comes forward and defends
fuller on the stumps, flicks it towards short midwicket
length ball in the corridor, comes forward before shouldering arms
fuller down the leg side and clipped that one way, past the diving Watling for four
short of length outside off, goes for the cut and misses as the ball moves away from him
length in the corridor, left alone
banged in short, on middle and leg, Shadman ducks under it quite comfortably
fuller around off and moving away like an off break after landing, Shadman came forward to defend but got beaten
length, fifth stump line. Shadman was stuck on the back foot, looks to defend and gets beaten
fuller but way too outside off, left alone
length ball in the corridor, left alone
length ball swinging away in the fifth-stump channel, left alone
full, close to off stump, nice stride forward to block to short extra

gone, this is brilliant bowling from Boult. Back of a length, angling into middle stump, and Mominul has to play at this. Nothing much he's done wrong, to be honest. It's swung away wickedly, squared him up with extra bounce, and he sends a thick edge to third slip where Southee takes it at waist height
full, slanting away from off stump, left alone
back of a length, angling across into the corridor, left alone
back of a length, swings back in towards off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
length ball swings back in and beats the inside edge of Shadman's half-forward defensive, lots of extra bounce too, to hit the thigh pad

trusts the bounce of this pitch and leaves on length, or he's completely misjudged the line - take your pick. Southee angles this across initially, and then it swings back to straighten into an off-stump line. Soars some four inches over off stump
back of a length now, steered into the point region
in the blockhole, swinging back in towards leg stump. Shadman hurriedly gets his front leg out of the way and looks to jam down on it. Thick edge runs away quickly past leg stump
full, angling across to off stump, gets his front leg out of the way again and defends into the covers - he's immensely aware of Southee's lbw threat, but that could open up other modes of dismissal
back of a length outside off, jumps across and frees his arms to punch through cover point
full, angling in towards off stump and threatening to swing away. Defended into the covers
drifts onto the pads, no swing on this occasion. Tucked away to long leg
back of a length, angling into a fairly wide line outside off, left alone

ooh, that nearly sneaks through. Full, swinging back in towards middle stump after angling across. Does well to get his front leg out of the way and jam his bat down to squeeze it towards midwicket off the inside half
shortish, rises up awkwardly towards the left ribcage. Jumps up to ride the bounce and fend awkwardly into the leg gully region
short again, slanting away into a tight line close to off stump. Does well to lift his hands high over his head and keep bat and gloves out of the way
full, angling across to a fourth-stump line, looks to drive and his bottom hand takes over a little. Hits it back towards the bowler instead of mid-off as, I suspect, he intended
lovely length, pitching on off stump and testing Shadman's judgment acutely - will this swing in or will it not? He watches it well and leaves it alone. It didn't swing back in enough to force a shot
bouncer now, rising quickly over middle stump, gets into a low crouch to evade it
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
shortish outside off, hops back and across to punch this away through cover point
full on middle and off, driven to mid-on

starts with a ripper, back of a length, slanting across the left-hander, threatening to swing back in but continuing across with extra bounce. Does well not to chase it with his hands, plays close to his body in defence and allows himself to be beaten
slants it across a little wider, left alone
sharp bouncer now, rising high over off stump. Thinks about hooking and then decides against it, choosing to weave out of the way instead
shot. Short, the angle gives Shadman a bit of width, and he uses the extra bounce of this surface to deliberately uppercut over point
beautiful. This is a length ball angling into a fourth-stump line, and he stays on the back foot to punch with a vertical bat through cover point
another good-looking shot, a cover drive to the full ball angling in from round the wicket. Can't beat the fielder at short extra, though.
length around off, comes forward and defends
fuller on the stumps, clips it away towards square leg for a couple
fuller around off, comes forward and punches it towards mid-off
a loud appeal for caught-behind but given not out. Length around off, nips back and beats the inside edge, brushes the back thigh on the way, outstanding decision
length around off, defended towards covers from the back foot
length ball in the corridor, left alone
back of length on middle and leg, hops in the air and drops it at his feet
short of length down the leg side, tucked away towards fine leg
back of length around off, defended from the back foot
length around off, comes forward and drives in the air, luckily it's in the gap between cover and extra cover, won't go all the way though
fuller on the pads, flicks it towards deep-backward square leg for two
length outside off, throws his bat at it, a thick outside edge goes over Southee at third slip
length ball in the corridor, left alone
a touch fuller but a similar line, shouldered arms once more
short of length outside off, goes back and punches it towards deep point
length around off, comes forward and defends
fuller outside off, left alone
length ball in the corridor, left alone
length around off, stays in the crease and defends towards cover
short ball has done the trick. Bouncer, near shoulder height, Shadman goes for the pull, the ball brushes the glove and Watling does the rest
length ball, angling across the batsman, left alone
short of length outside off, sways away to leave it alone
fuller around off, driven firmly towards the bowler from the front foot, Henry intercepts in his followthrough
length ball around middle and off, stays back and defends it into the ground
length ball in the corridor, left alone
a bouncer from Wagner, angling away from the batsman who looks to pull but is nowhere near it
short of length in the rib cage, moves towards the off side and dabs it towards leg slip
short of length around off, goes deep in his crease, gets on the top of bounce and defends
short of length angling away, drops his wrists and lets it go through
a bouncer from Wagner, Mithun ducks under quite comfortably
short of length in the rib cage, dabs it towards square leg from the back foot
length around off, stays back and taps it towards gully
a bouncer from Henry, on middle and leg, Soumya ducks under
short of length around middle and leg, defended with soft hands towards backward point
fuller around off, stays back and blocks
short of length around off, Soumya arches back and it lets it go through
short of length on middle and leg, rising towards the batsman who hops back and drops it down, the ball hits near the handle
fuller around off, Mithun was hanging back, steers it towards extra cover
a bouncer on the leg stump Mithun is happy to duck under those
another short one but down the leg side, Mithun moves inside the line of the ball
length ball around middle and off, defended from the crese
short of length around middle and leg and flies across the batsman who was looking to defend it, ends up playing inside the line
short of length around off, stays back and dabs it towards gully
fuller around off, goes for the drive but fails to keep it low, was in the air but in the gap as well, not the best of the timing though
length around off, played with angled bat, steered past the gully fielder
fuller on the pads, flicked away towards fine leg
length ball on the pads, stays back and defends it towards square leg
length around off, a bit of wobble in the air, Soumya looks to defend  but gets beaten
short of length, stays leg side of the ball and taps it towards point
short of length outside off, left alone
around the length ball around off, goes deep and defends
short of length around off, moves away and steers it over the slip cordon for four
short of length around off, angling away, defended from the back foot
a bouncer this time, aimed at the batsman who ducks under and lets it sail through
short of length around off, stays on the back foot and defends it towards gully
fuller on the pads, looks to flick but misses, was heading down though
fuller outside off, comes forward and punches it through covers for a lovely boundary
fuller on the stumps, clipped away in front of square, good timing as well, beating the man at deep square leg
banged in short, outside off as well, Soumya ducks under but he didn't even need to
another short one outside off, left alone
short of length angling at the batsman who takes the bottom hand off and fends it towards leg slip
short again, around off and middle this time, hops back in the crease and drops it down
short of length down the leg side, stays deep and whips it uppishly, to the left of third man for four
a bouncer around off this time, Mithun ducks under without any difficulty
short of length down the leg side, Mithun moves inside the line and lets it go through
short of length around off, stays deep in the crease and defends
length around off, stands in his crease and taps it towards gully
length ball on the stumps, drives it on the up, fails to keep it down, bounces just in front of Henry at mid-on who dives across to make the stop
a bouncer from Boult, goes for the pull  but is late on the shot and gets beaten
length ball around off, a bit of shape away, gets behind it and blocks
length ball outside off, moving away from the batsman, left alone
goes for the yorker, on the leg stump, Soumya gets his bat in front to keep it out
length ball slanting across into a fourth-stump line, gets forward for a push into the covers. Plays slightly early and hits it uppishly, just wide of Nicholls diving to his right at short cover
a little wider outside off, left alone
fullish on off stump, defended into the cover point region
length ball, pitching on off stump and continuing on with the angle across, good leave
another excellent leave. Southee goes a little wider on the crease, and pitches it within the stumps - around middle and off - but Soumya reads the angle well and leaves it. No swing yet today
on the pads, clipped into the square leg region

great delivery to start. Just short of a length, pitching on middle and off and curling away late to open up Soumya and beat his outside edge. Does well to keep his bat close to his body and not push at the ball
full now, on off stump, punched back to the bowler
fullish on middle and leg, clipped to the left of mid-on
right-hander at the crease, Boult takes some time getting his line right. Slants this too far across and allows Mithun an easy leave
on the dot this time, length ball attacking the top of off stump. Stays back and defends compactly back down the pitch
back of a length on leg stump, takes a step back and across to play the leg glance. Can't connect, but gets a helpful tickle off the thigh pad to place it past the wicketkeeper's left hand
bouncer rising high over off stump, forces Bocock to jump up with outstretched right arm to collect it after Soumya sways away from the line
back of a length, straightens slightly in the corridor, left alone
lovely shot. Full, angled away from off stump, and Soumya can free his arms and drive it over extra-cover
good leave, full again but not quite as full. Pitched just outside off and then gripped and cut away off the seam
nice length again, full but short of driving length, and angling away from off stump to try and tempt the drive away from the body. Soumya watches it well and ignores it
bouncer rising over off stump at a relatively gentle pace, Soumya crouches under it
full, close to off stump, punched towards mid-on with the full face showing
length ball slanting across to a sixth-stump line, left alone
short ball rising to chest height over off stump. Hops to ride the bounce and keep it down into the leg side, played that with nice soft hands
short again, angles marginally wider, and Mithun can't get behind the line while jumping to ride the bounce. Awkwardly keeps it down into the gully region, taking his bottom hand off the bat handle
full now, angling across into the fifth-stump channel, left alone. Didn't really get his front foot forward to that - may have been the effect of the previous two balls
length ball slanting across, pitching on off and continuing along the left-arm-over angle. Mithun leaves again
fuller, still a little too wide to make Mithun play
gorgeous. Full, a hint of swing in towards off stump, shows the full face and drives it crisply between the fielder at short mid-off and the non-striker
full again, a little wider, driven to cover
length ball angling across towards the top of off stump, stays back and defends into the point region
dug in short, rises to chest height just outside off, stands tall and keeps it down into the point region with soft hands
overpitched, a bit of width, driven firmly but straight to short extra-cover
length ball pitching just outside off and continuing to angle away from the left-hander, left alone
back of a length close to off stump, defended to short extra-cover
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, defended from the crease, back down the pitch

shortish outside off, punched nicely into the cover point region. They're slow taking the third run, and a more accurate throw from de Grandhomme - who chased back from backward point - and a better collection from the keeper, who fumbled after moving a couple of feet in front of the crease to collect - could have had Soumya run out.
back of a length outside off, a bit of away movement to beat his defensive push
back of a length, angling into the thigh pad, defended into the on side
back of a length, straightens slightly to square up Soumya and he squeezes it down towards gully off the outside half of the bat
fullish, angling into off stump, stays back and defends to midwicket
back of a length outside off, gets on his toes to punch into the point region
good ball, angling across to pitch on off stump and take off from a fullish length. Bocock collects over his head after Soumya leaves it
very full on off stump, almost in the blockhole, opens his bat face to squeeze it to the left of backward point

length ball, slanting away into a fifth-stump line, and Soumya throws his hands at a drive, a long way from his body. Southee has the covers packed, for a shot just like that, but on this occasion he slices it square, to the right of backward point

dropped. Knee-high full-toss on off stump and Soumya punches it back to the bowler, at about waist height, and he can't grab on while tumbling to his left in his follow-through. It didn't come off the bat with too much power at all
back of a length, angling across to a fifth-stump line, jabbed to backward point
bouncer rising high over off stump, Mithun ducks just in case
bouncer over leg stump, this time the line is more at the body and Mithun has to duck in a hurry
full outside off, driven to the left of short extra-cover
beauty. Shortish lifter on off stump, straightens and zips past the outside edge as Soumya gets squared up in defence
shortish again, similar line. This one behaves more predictably and Soumya gets behind the line to block it back down the pitch
full outside off, goes for a drive and a thick outside edge falls just short of gully
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
length ball in the corridor, left alone
fullish, fifth-stump line, Mithun leaves again
lovely shot. Good-length ball angling into off stump, and Mithun punches it straight back, between the umpire and the non-striker with the full face of the bat displayed proudly
fullish, just outside off, punched firmly to mid-off

and he gets his man - he's bowled a few like this today. Back of a length, hits a tight line close to off stump and gets it to straighten with extra bounce. Sarkar isn't behind the line to defend this, his feet are off the ground, and he gets a thick edge that Ross Taylor holds onto at first slip, catching it in front of his chest and falling backwards
awkward delivery to get first up, back of a length and nipping away slightly after pitching within the line of the stumps. Gets squared up and the thick edge doesn't carry to third slip
back of a length, angling away from off stump, left alone
sharp bouncer on a tight line close to off stump, Mahmudullah drops his gloves under the ball and pulls his upper body out of the way
back of a length on middle and leg, defended into the leg side
back of a length close to off stump, punched into the covers
back of a length, fourth-stump line, left alone
fullish, close to off stump, defended back down the pitch
fullish outside off, defended into the covers
bouncer, rises well over Mithun's head at a gentle pace, ducks just in case
back of a length on off stump, lets it come to him and punches into the backward point region
full, just outside off, driven to mid-off
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
length ball on middle stump, keeps his front pad out of the way to block to short extra-cover
back of a length, pitching on off stump and slanting away sharply - bowled this from wider on the crease. Left alone
stays back to a length ball straightening slightly towards off stump, blocks it back towards Boult
short ball rising to chest height over middle stump. Stays leg side of the ball and gets off his feet to defend into the off side
sharp bouncer over off stump, shaping back in late to cramp Mahmudullah for room. Does well to drop his wrists and sway his head and shoulders away from the line
length ball on middle stump, stays back and blocks it back to the bowler
full outside off, driven to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
length ball, shifts his line wider, a couple of feet outside off stump. Left alone
full, finds some late inswing towards middle and off. Looks to flick and gets a thick edge into his front pad
fullish, this time he angles it into middle and leg, clipped gently through square leg
full, angling into off stump, blocked to short extra-cover
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, defended towards midwicket
shifts his line a little fuller, stays on the back foot regardless to defend this to midwicket from just in front of off stump
length ball, fourth-stump line, defended into the covers
full, angling into middle and off, punched towards mid-on
back of a length, fifth-stump line, left alone
back of a length, nipping in towards leg stump.  Beats Mithun's defensive bat and hits him on the thigh pad
shortish on middle stump, jumps up to get on top of the bounce and defend back towards the bowler
bouncer over leg stump, Mahmudullah ducks under it
short, but only gets up to chest height on middle stump, and Mahmudullah whips it away through backward square leg with a short-arm pull, front leg up in the air
quicker and more effort on this bouncer, zips over the top of Mahmudullah's glove as he goes for another pull
back of a length on leg stump, Mahmudullah glances it away fine, between the keeper and leg gully
short ball slightly outside leg stump. Mahmudullah steps across to evade it, lifting his bat high over his head
length ball outside off, driven past short extra-cover, who gets a bit of bad bounce, and mid-off moves to his left to stop the ball
bouncer over off stump, rises steeply and he evades it with a half-crouch

good ball, back of a length and angling in towards the top of off stump. Mithun's bat comes down at an angle, from around gully - the open stance contributes to this - and he ends up slicing across the ball a little in defence, gets a thick outside edge towards point
fuller now, punched to mid-on
length ball angling in towards off stump, gets on the front foot to defend back towards the bowler
full on off stump and that's nicely put away, clipped away in the air, but into the big gap to the right of mid-on
short on off stump, and again Mahmudullah plays that short-arm whip-pull, just taps it on top of the bounce, and swivels on his back foot, to place it towards the backward square leg boundary
what's he done here? Jumps away towards the leg side as Wagner bangs this in, angling across to off stump, and looks to ramp over gully. Can't connect, though
short again, attacking the left ribcage. Jumps back and across and tucks it towards fine leg
another bouncer, now Mithun steps away to the leg side to attempt that ramp over the slips. Bounces too high for him to connect

awkward. Jumps back and across to another bouncer angling across towards off stump. Was he trying to fend it or leave it? Ends up basically letting the ball hit his chest - I hope he's wearing a chest guard
another bouncer, slightly down leg, steps across and ignores it
length around off, Mahmudullah goes back and punches it towards point, a bit of awkward bounce for the fielder, the ball goes over his head after landing
nips back in from a length around off and middle to beat the bat, hits Mahmudullah on the pads but was heading down
erring on the pads not, fuller on the leg stump and clipped away towards deep square leg for four more
back of length around off, stays back and defends it on the off side
short one outside off, left alone without any concerns
bouncer this time, short ball in the corridor, but too high, and called a wide
length outside off, goes for the cut, gets a thick outside that flies way over where third slip would have been
short of length on the leg stump, Mithun ducks under it
back of length around middle and off, angling away from the batsman who defends it along the body
another short one but down the leg side, Mithun once again ducks under
short of length around off, angling towards the batsman, stays back and drops it down towards short leg
short ball angling down the leg side, Mithun gets underneath it without any difficulty
short of length around off, goes back and pulls it behind square for four more. Bangladesh only 71 behind now
length around off, moves towards the off stump and defends
length around off and middle, flicks it towards midwicket
a touch fuller on the stumps, works it towards square leg for a couple
length ball on the off stump, stays in the crease and defends it towards the bowler
fuller outside off, nipping in after landing, Mahmudullah goes for the drive but gets beaten on the inside edge
length around fifth stump and moving away, left alone by Mahmudullah
the short-barrage continues from Wagner, this one is on the leg stump, Mithun ducks under

and the short plan has eventually worked. Short of length near the rib cage, Mithun pivots to pull it behind square but ends up hitting it to Southee's left at backward square leg who take a nice tumbling catch
starts with a short of length around off, left alone
a touch fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards covers
short of length around off, stays back and the crease and defends with a straight bat
short of length around off, angling away from Liton who ducks under
length ball around off, stays in the crease and blocks
back of length around off, rises on the toes and punches it behind point for four
length ball on middle and leg, taps it towards square leg
fuller, just outside off, goes for the drive and gets beaten as the ball moves slightly away
fuller around off, a bit of inswing, comes forward and defends
length ball on the stumps, stays back and defends it on the leg side with a vertical bat
short of length at 135.6kph, on the leg stump, Liton ducks under
short on middle and leg, goes for the pull but fails to keep it down, one bounce to Trent Boult at fine leg

falls in the no-man's land. Short one at the batsman, Mahmudullah fails to keep the pull down, ends up top-edging it towards square leg, Bocock chases it but cannot reach there, Raval was coming in from the deep square leg but I think he pulled out when he saw the keeper charging in, short leg was late to react anyway and had to turn around. In the end, it falls well away from Bocock
short one snares another Bangladesh batsman. Liton Das this time. Goes for the pull but fails to keep it down again, and this time it carries to Boult at fine leg
short of length angling into the batsman, Taijul ducks under
short of length on the leg stump, Taijul moves towards the off side and tucks it behind, towards the keeper
short of length outside off, works it behind point for a couple, the throw is well over the keeper's head, lazy backing up by Raval and they get two overthrows
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards backward point
length but way too outside off, Mahmudullah moves towards it before realising it's too far away
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it past point, beats the man at sweeper cover, moves to 40 off 44
a bouncer around off, but too high to trouble Mahmudullah who ducks under
bouncer outside off, Mahmudullah backs away and pulls it in front of square, not in full control but it's all empty real estate there
short but way too down the leg side, Taijul moves further inside the line
no, that's not how Wagner operates. Another short one, on the leg stump this time, Taijul moves across and looks to pull, misses
short of length around off, hops in the air and defends, not from the middle though
Wagner has his third. Short of length around off, Taijul hops and fends at it, the ball hits him on the glove and goes towards silly point, Latham takes a comfortable catch
short again, on middle and leg, almost puts Mustafizur in a tangle who somehow manages to sway away
short one but down the leg side, Mustafizur stays away from the line
fuller around off, stays in the crease and taps it towards covers
length ball around off, stays in the crease and pushes it on the off side, with a straight bat
length ball angling in towards the batsman who takes it on, swings it towards square leg and he has got enough on it to take it all the way
fuller on the stumps and this time lofted over mid-off, doesn't get the timing right this time though and they scamper back for the second
length ball around off, stays back in his crease and defends with a straight bat
fuller on the stumps, puts his bat in front to defend it towards cover
short of length around off, goes for the pull but not in control, gets a top edge that flies over the keeper
short of length once again, backs away and swats it towards long-on, clubbed away for another four, gets to his fifty
short of length around off, doesn't bounce as much, Mahmudullah was hops in the crease, a thick outside edge towards point
a slower one, fuller around off, looks to slice it away, misses
short of length in the line of the stumps, backs away and looks to swat, a thick edge over the bowler's head, mid-on cannot reach there in time
a bouncer around off stump, Mustafizur ducks under
length around off, stays in his crease and dabs it towards cover-point
length ball around off, moving in a bit off the seam, stays back and defends solidly
a bouncer from Southee, around off and middle, Mahmudullah sways away
length outside off, taps it behind point for one
short of length around off, Mustafizur stays inside the line of the ball
fuller on the pads, helped away towards deep square leg, and they turn down the single
short of length around off, defends it towards point
fuller, almost a yorker outside off, Mahmudullah gets his bat down to intercepts
a bouncer on middle and leg, ducked under
short of length around off, gets Mahmudullah jumping who somehow manages to dab it down. Some words from Wagner
short of length and Mahmudullah backs away, pulls it in front of square, a top edge that goes over midwicket, they come back for the second
a bouncer down the leg side, looks to pull it away, cannot connect
short of length around off, Mustafizur swings wildly, gets a top edge and it sails over the keeper, his second six of the innings
short of length around off, looks to ramp over the slips, misses
fuller on middle and leg, backs away and looks to hit it down the ground, mistimed towards square leg
fuller in the corridor, left alone
length around off, stays back and steers it behind point for four more, his 12th of the innings
bouncer but way down the leg side, Boult gets away with that one
short of length around off, backs away and looks to ramp, misses
short outside off, backs away and looks to smash, misses again
short of length around off, once again trying to ramp it over, another miss
short of length down the leg side, ducks under. Wagner is not happy with his line here
short of length, just around off, looks to cut it away but too close to the body, misses
fuller around middle, Mustafizur swings again, aiming to go over the top, ends up skying it towards long-off. Both batsmen are ball watching and in the end can only get a single
an attempted yorker but ends up as a low full toss on the leg stump, pushed on the leg side
short of length outside off, left alone
and the middle stump is out of the ground. Fuller on the stumps, backs away and looks to smash down the ground, misses and the stumps are in a disarray

short ball aimed at the batsman who gets in a tangle, fending at the ball, as it whizzes past. A loud appeal for caught-behind, not-out says umpire Palliyaguruge. Southee decides to reviews but nothing on the HotSpot, a flat line on Snicko and New Zealand lose their review
fuller around off and angling away, hangs his bat out and gets beaten
fuller, in fact a low full toss around off, pushes it towards covers
short of length in the rib cage, dabs it towards square leg
short of length around off, backs away and cuts it over backward point, all the way for a six
short of length but down the leg side this time, no contact with the bat
short again and Mahmudullah goes for the pull, gets a top edge towards fine leg, Boult moves to his right, settles under and takes a good catch near the boundary
fuller outside off, looks to play at it and misses

that's a five-wicket haul for Wagner. And the series for New Zealand which means they stay at No. 2 in the ICC rankings irrespective of the what happens in the third Test. Coming back to the delivery, it was full and straight, Ebadat backs away but fails to put bat on the ball and the ball clatters into the middle and leg stump
